DOC.brief_summary: The principal objective is to notice the relevance of timing performance of femoral block for knee replacement surgery during general anesthesia and analyze the relationship with bilateral bispectral index (BIS) monitoring during induction and maintenance of anesthesia. Otherwise the investigators try to investigate if the timing of performance of this block influence in postoperative variables as pain or blood loss.
DOC.brief_title: Bilateral Bispectral Index (BIS)-Monitoring in Trauma Surgery
DOC.criteria: ASA IV, patients with difficult airway management, patients with antecedent of cerebral ischemia, presence of atrioventricular fistula, patients with absent distal pulses or history of vascular surgery in the involved limbs, patients with high risk of deep vein thrombosis.
